meanings.definition: A large body of matter with no definite shape.
meanings.sent1: The mountain was a massive mass of rock.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the mass of the asteroid.
meanings.sent3: The mass of toys in the playroom made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent4: The mass of clouds in the sky resembled a fluffy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The mass of books on the shelf threatened to topple over.

meanings.definition: The amount of matter in an object.
meanings.sent1: The mass of water in the glass was enough for a sip.
meanings.sent2: The mass of the planet determines its gravitational pull.
meanings.sent3: The mass of chocolate in the cake made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The mass of thoughts in her mind weighed heavily on her.
meanings.sent5: The mass of stars in the galaxy is incomprehensible.

meanings.definition: A large number of people or objects crowded together.
meanings.sent1: The mass of fans at the concert cheered loudly.
meanings.sent2: The mass of cars in the parking lot created a traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: The mass of balloons at the party added a festive touch.
meanings.sent4: The mass of students in the hallway rushed to their classes.
meanings.sent5: The mass of birds in the sky formed intricate patterns.
